Can’t add Symbolics.jl (in an empty environment). Isn’t that supposed to work?
```(symbolics) pkg> add Symbolics
   Resolving package versions...
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package AbstractAlgebra [c3fe647b]:
 AbstractAlgebra [c3fe647b] log:
 ├─AbstractAlgebra [c3fe647b] has no known versions!
 └─found to have no compatible versions left with Symbolics [0c5d862f]
   └─Symbolics [0c5d862f] log:
     ├─possible versions are: 0.1.0 or uninstalled
     └─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions 0.1.0```

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Just worked for me, but in 1.6. What version are you on?

text: Removed and readded General registry and then it worked. No idea why it wouldn’t work before that.
